questionText: What types of addresses can own an address-owned object in IOTA?

answerOptions.answerText: Only account addresses derived from signature schemes
Either an account address or an object ID, both being 32-byte addresses

questionText: Which function should you use to create an address-owned object when defining a custom transfer policy?
Once an address-owned object is created, what is true about its sharing capabilities?

answerOptions.answerText: It can be shared with multiple addresses simultaneously
It cannot be shared with others after creation
It can be converted into a shared object at any time
It automatically becomes a shared object after transfer

questionText: In which scenario can you access an address-owned object directly during a transaction in IOTA?

answerOptions.answerText: When the owner address corresponds to an object ID
When the owner address is a signature-derived account address signing the transaction
When the object is public and not owned by any address
When you have the object's UID and permissions
